did.abstract: Member of the Michigan National Guard and commander of the 2nd Battalion, 126th Infantry during World War II. Clippings and other materials relating to the New Guinea campaign, the work of the State Office of Veterans Affairs, 1944-1947, and Ann Arbor Golden Gloves Boxing Tournaments, 1937-1939.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Mrs. Garnet J. Burlingame (donor no. 6796

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Garnet J. Burlingame papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

processinfo.p: [Delete this set of tags if not needed for digital material processing]

bioghist.p: Garnet J. Burlingame was a member of the Michigan National Guard and commander of the 2nd Battalion, 126th Infantry during World War II.

scopecontent.p: The Burlingame papers consists of Personal and Military papers relating to his career with the 126th Infantry of West Michigan 32nd Division. Some of these papers document the march over Owen Stanley Mountains in New Guinea in 1942. There are also clippings relating to Ann Arbor Golden Gloves Boxing Tournaments, 1937-1939.

did.unittitle: Ann Arbor Men History of the 126th
March Over the Owen Stanley Mountains, 1942
Photograph of soldiers outside of the Ann Arbor Armory; and photographs demonstrating modern infantry weapons
Photograph of Tom Harmon at Michigan Stadium.
